About:  "This identifier is required to be no more than 45 characters."
A length of 45 requires that WL server and/or cluster names must then be kept unusually short -- so maybe we should advise that the domain-uid be far shorter as a "rule of thumb" both here and in the new 'restrictions' section?   Something like:
"This identifier is strictly required to be no more than 45 characters, and, as a rule of thumb, should be less than ?20? characters in order to help ensure RFC 1123 [restrictions](link to restrictions doc) are met.
